page.title: 18ST.NICHOLAS CHURCH,W.BOLDON
page.content: A beautiful church, which is named St. Nicholas's was built in 1220 in West Boldon. Father Arthur Middleton has been Rector there for six years. He has also written religious booklets and given epilogues on television. The three main services he holds each day are, Matins in the early morning, the Eucharist and then Evensong. The most attended service is the Eucharist, 90-100 people come each Sunday. He holds about 12 weddings , 12 Baptisms and about 35 Funerals a year. The activities held mostly go on in the Aubrey Leake Hall, which is the church hall. It was named after the Rector Aubrey Leake who was rector for 31 years. It was 1936. The Rector gives an assembly every Wednesday at the Chuch School. Every two years the pupils give a Nativity Play in the church.
